summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 2019 discussing victim compensation applications for Epstein victims. It involves FBI Victim Services Division and the Office for Victims of Crime (OVS) coordinating on whether victims who recently disclosed abuse can still apply for compensation, with a request for a prosecutorial letter from SDNY.

events.title: OVS indicates possibility of victim compensation
events.description: An OVS representative states that if they receive a letter from a DA or AUSA indicating they would have prosecuted if the case had been brought timely, they can cover victim compensation.

events.title: FBI Victim Services forwards compensation request to SDNY
events.description: The FBI Victim Services Division forwards a request about Epstein victim compensation to the Southern District of New York (SDNY) for assistance.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively working with several Epstein victims in the NYC area in August-September 2019.
Victims had recently disclosed abuse that happened years prior, raising questions about eligibility for compensation.
The Office for Victims of Crime (OVS) indicated compensation might be possible with a prosecutorial letter from a DA or AUSA.
There was internal FBI coordination between New York Field Office and Victim Services Division regarding these victim applications.
The email chain shows bureaucratic processes for victim compensation following Epstein's arrest and death.
